bug.author: unagaraju88
bug.summary: Manage Contributor is not there in kubeflow UI 1.0.1
bug.description:
/kind bug Manage Contributor option is not there in the kubeflow UI
[A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] After installing kubeflow kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.1.yaml , I logged into kubeflow UI with default namespace (anonymous)as per the steps <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/azure/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/azure/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
But I do not see manage contributor option. I created the kubernetes cluster and deployed kubeflow. What did you expect to happen: I expected that by default namespace, I get admin privilege to view "Manage Contributor" Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 1.0 kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.1.yaml this is the file I used to deploy kubeflow. kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl v1.0.1-0-gf3edb9b Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) Azure Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.15.7 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 7.6 (Maipo) 3.10.0-957.43.1.el7.x86_64

comments.comment:

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/unagaraju88>@unagaraju88</denchmark-link> Using kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.1.yaml is really a single user install so Manage Contributor will not be applicable Review <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/components/multi-tenancy/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/components/multi-tenancy/</denchmark-link>
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
